name: briouates
ingredients: Filling of your choice (e.g., ground meat, cheese, almonds)

For the ground meat filling: Ground meat (250g), 1 minced onion, 1 tbsp chopped parsley leaves, 1 tsp spices of your choice (ras el hanout, ground ginger), 1 pinch of cinnamon, 1-2 tbsp breadcrumbs, 1-2 eggs, salt and pepper, grated cheese, hard-boiled egg, olives
steps: Prepare the filling: Sauté the onion in olive oil. Add the ground meat, season with salt, pepper, spices, and cinnamon. Cook until the water evaporates.
Add the chopped parsley, olive slices, grated cheese, and hard-boiled egg cut into small cubes. Mix and let cool.
Cut each brick sheet in half or into strips (depending on the desired shape: triangle or 'rolls').
Place a spoonful of filling at one end and fold into a triangle or roll into a spiral.
Seal the briouate by tucking the pointed end into the fold or using beaten egg.
Fry in hot oil or bake in the oven (160°C for about 25 minutes) until golden.
